item.description: Update Cliff Rescue; INC#1163; 03:55PM; 1605 N Gilcrest Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3jlOMoM; #BeverlyCrest; LAFD ground crews hiked the steep hillside to successfully search for and find the 5 year-old male, who fell a yet to be determined distance. He is conscious with unspecified injuries or medical condition, and will soon be lowered via an LAFD rope system to a property below, where he will be loaded into an LAFD ground ambulance, and accompanied by his mother for transport to a regional trauma center.; FS 108; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 BC9 E108 E227 E237 E27 EM9 HR3 RA78 RH114 T27 T37 UR88; CH8; 18; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1135; 03:51PM; 3750 S Glendon Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3v1tORy; #Palms; *Address Correction* From Venice Blvd to Glendon Ave. 64 LAFD Firefighters, assisted by Culver City FD in Automatic Aid, took just 28 minutes in offensive firefighting operations to access, confine and fully extinguish fire in one 3rd (top) floor unit at a 3 story garden-style apartment building. No injury. Fire cause under investigation. ; FS 43; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; BC18 E263 E292 E43 E58 E62 T63 T92 + Culver City FD in Automatic Aid; CH9; 14; Brian Humphrey

Cliff Rescue; INC#1163; 03:32PM; 1605 N Gilcrest Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3jlOMoM; #BeverlyCrest; PRELIM: Mother states she saw her 5 year-old son fall out of sight down a steep (brush covered?) hillside behind a home she was visiting. ; FS 108; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 BC9 E108 E227 E237 E27 EM9 HR3 RA78 RH114 T27 T37 UR88; CH8; 18; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1135; 03:23PM; 10800 W Venice Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Jqmy6N; #Palms; Address Tentative. PRELIM: 3 story garden-style apartments over subterranean parking with fire showing from one 3rd (top) floor unit.; FS 43; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; BC18 E263 E292 E43 E58 T63 T92 + Culver City FD; CH9; 14; Brian Humphrey

Update #SolanoFire - Knockdown Brush Fire; INC#0545; 10:25AM; 1231 North Broadway; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DRAZ2J; #ElysianPark; Though *Address Corrected* From Solano Avenue to Broadway, this wildfire will still be known as the "Solano Fire". The first arriving 50 LAFD ground-based firefighters took just 24 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish what airborne firefighters have determined to be one-quarter (0.25) acre of medium brush. Though some structures, including an apartment building were in the path of advancing flames, proper vegetation clearance gave firefighters a defensive advantage and prevented the buildings from being directly threatened by flames. No injury. No evacuation. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; AO1 BC1 BC11 BC2 CM22 E1 E16 E201 E203 E209 E220 E29 E290 E33 E38 E44 E56 E6 E9 EM1 H1 H2 H5 HA1 HA2 HA5 RA1 T1 T20 T3 T9 T90 + LACoFD Air Ops; CH5; 13; Brian Humphrey

Update #SolanoFire Brush Fire; INC#0545; 10:15AM; 564 W Solano Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DVwm7J; #ElysianPark; This active wildfire, known as the "Solano Fire" has now consumed one (1) acre of medium brush. Fire spread is topography driven with light wind. Some structures, including an apartment building to advancing flames, but thanks to vegetation clearance, are not immediately threatened. No injury. No evacuation.; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; AO1 BC1 BC11 BC2 CM22 E1 E16 E201 E203 E209 E220 E29 E290 E33 E38 E44 E56 E6 E9 EM1 H1 H2 H5 HA1 HA2 HA5 RA1 T1 T20 T3 T9 T90; CH5; 13; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#0545; 10:01AM; 564 W Solano Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DVwm7J; #ElysianPark; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response to one-half (0.50) acre vegetation burning slowly uphill, fanned by 5 mph winds.; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC2 E201 E203 E209 E220 E29 E290 E44 E9 EM1 H0A H0B RA1 T1 T20 T3 T9 T90; CH5; 13; Brian Humphrey

item.description: Update Traffic Collision with Entrapment; INC#1832; 11:20PM; 3016 S Motor Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/35QxOvp; #CheviotHills; Both trapped patients have been freed. Five Patients Total (2 Critical / 3 Minor Injuries). No further details. Media Inquiries; LAPD West Traffic Division (Incident #4759); FS 92; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; BC18 E292 E43 E59 EM11 EM14 EM9 HR3 RA19 RA43 RA59 RA71 RA858 T92; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey
